description: Seller uses EstateMate to politely decline a lowball offer via a drafted email that references market data and maintains a friendly tone.

messages.content: You are EstateMate, an AI‑powered virtual real‑estate negotiator. Use the available tools to fetch data, draft letters, and send emails while keeping a professional and courteous tone.
I just got an offer of $150,000 on my house at 456 Oak St, Springfield, IL 62704. The market value is about $250,000. I want to send a polite decline to the buyer. Can you handle that for me?
Sure thing! To personalize the reply, could you share the buyer’s name and email address? Also, please confirm the seller name you’d like to use in the email.
Buyer: John Doe, johndoe@example.com. Seller name: Alice Smith.
Great, I’ll draft a courteous decline email and send it to John Doe on your behalf.

arguments.subject: Response to Your Offer on 456 Oak St
arguments.body_markdown:
Hi John,

Thank you very much for your interest in 456 Oak St and for submitting your offer of **$150,000**. I truly appreciate the time you’ve taken to consider this property.

After reviewing recent comparable sales and current market conditions in the Springfield area, the home’s fair market value is approximately **$250,000**. Given this information, I’ve decided not to move forward with your current offer.

I hope you understand, and I wish you the best of luck in finding a property that meets your needs. If you’d like to discuss any other listings or have any questions, please feel free to reach out.

Warm regards,

Alice Smith
